head.title: the empress anastasia in new york

lg.l: to be the only member of
of women who nod in doorways
in my mother's house there are
missile crisis got stuck in my childhood
and mother still writes how she
please give me a little piece
change from out of the north
is burning. she never saw the neva.
i plan to quit my job.

back.p: Jan Clausen writes poetry, fiction, and critical prose. She is the author of a book of poems, After Touch (Out and Out Books, 1975) and "The Politics of Publishing and the Lesbian Communityâ (Sinister Wisdom, no. 2, 1977). With friends, she edits Conditions, a magazine of women's writing with emphasis on work by lesbians.
